page.title: 05STANGHOW
page.content: STANGHOW IS A SPREAD-OUT VILLAGE CONSISTING OF LOW STANGHOW, WITH STANGHOW HALL, HOME FARM, WELL FARM AND THREE TERRACED COTTAGES BEING THE NUCLEUS OF THE ORIGINAL SETTLEMENT: THERE IS ALSO A LARGE DERELICT HOUSE. THERE ARE FOUR SEMI-DETACHED BUNGALOWS AND THREE DETACHED BUNGALOWS BUILT IN THE 1960'S. HIGH STANGHOW IS SITUATED AT THE CROSSROADS WHERE THERE IS AN OLD CHAPEL, NOW USED AS A COMMUNITY CENTRE, AND A TELEPHONE KIOSK. HERE THE HOUSING IS OLDER AND CONSISTS OF TERRACED DWELLINGS, ONE BLOCK OF SIX HOUSES, ONE BLOCK OF THREE; AND SPREADING FROM THESE ARE SIX SEMI-DETACHED BUNGALOWS AND SIX DETACHED HOUSES BUILT IN THE 1940'S. THE VILLAGE IS SITUATED ON HIGH OPEN LAND SURROUNDED MAINLY BY FARMLAND.
